original_text: We had a wonderful dinner meal here during our quick trip in Paris. Very close to Notre Dame. The restaurant has an option during good weather to eat outside on the bridge nearby! Beautiful view. Wish we would have know before choosing our seat at the window. Deviled eggs! 10/10 and our beef and chicken dishes were both awesome

Beautiful view. Wish we would have know before choosing our seat at the window. Deviled eggs! 10/10 and our beef and chicken dishes were both awesome

Rôtisserie d’Argent offers a nice dining experience, especially for tourists seeking an authentic taste of French cuisine. The service is great thought the food isn’t mind-blowing, but. it’s certainly enjoyable. The roasted chicken and traditional dishes cater to those looking for a typical French culinary adventure.

original_text: A great place to dine if you want a traditional French meal. One of my favorite restaurants during my visit.l to Paris! We ordered the burrata appetizer, the chicken and beef rib steak and the most incredible dessert. The staff (Jeremy and Rick helped us) here are incredibly nice and profession and make the experience even more enjoyable! Highly recommend !
text: A great place to dine if you want a traditional French meal. One of my favorite restaurants during my visit.l to Paris! We ordered the burrata appetizer, the chicken and beef rib steak and the most incredible dessert. The staff (Jeremy and Rick helped us) here are incredibly nice and profession and make the experience even more enjoyable! Highly recommend !

I had dinner here with my family. The food are delicious and the portions are big. However, when we asked for medium for the steak, it came out as medium-rare. We had to ask to send back. Besides the head server was the only one with some kind of knowledge of their wine list, their overall service was terrible. When serving the duck to me, our server accidentally poured the juice/sauce into my wine glass, yet he did not apologize nor do anything about it. I had to ask the head server for a resolution, he then poured a new glass of wine for me. The service training of this bistro is poor.

original_text: First things first, this place does not have the same views as La Tour d’Argent. It’s just bistro on street-level, contrary to the pictures posted here. I will just assume the diners simply mixed up the restaurants when posting their reviews. We booked a table on the terrace but were disappointed to find out the terrace just meant a table by the window. Next, onto the actual restaurant experience. It is the worst dining experience we had in Paris. Staff completely ignored our requests to order and told us to give them a moment, but we observed them greeting and serving other newer customers first. When we finally ordered, the food took ages to arrive. We were still waiting for our mains when the table behind us already finished their meal and left. Escargots were fine, nothing special. We got the beef fillet medium rare, but was still raw and cold in the middle. Also, the entire duck for €98 could have easily been for four people instead. It was way too much just for two. Food presentation was very plain and could have been much better. And I suggest maybe serving customers a sharper knife to cut meat next time, the knives we got could well have just been used for bread. The only reason we came here was because La Tour d’Argent was closed that day, so we hoped for a similar experience. But unfortunately it was extremely disappointing. Would give 0 stars if it were possible.

original_text: Wonderful meal. Friendly, courteous, and professional staff. Excellent custom wine pairing by the sommelier. We enjoyed one of a kind meal watching night fall over Paris from a great vantage point. Well worth it.
text: Wonderful meal. Friendly, courteous, and professional staff. Excellent custom wine pairing by the sommelier. We enjoyed one of a kind meal watching night fall over Paris from a great vantage point. Well worth it.

original_text: A meal that was savored and enjoyed from start to finish. We first visited in 1982 and the Duck Dellair was a unique preparation. We had the foie gras and tomatoes. Shared the Duck and ended with a black current soufflé (in 1982 it was strawberry). A great wine from their extensive list. But the beautiful ambiance, and kind and attentive service made the experience sublime. We are grateful to the whole staff for such a memorable evening.
text: A meal that was savored and enjoyed from start to finish. We first visited in 1982 and the Duck Dellair was a unique preparation. We had the foie gras and tomatoes. Shared the Duck and ended with a black current soufflé (in 1982 it was strawberry). A great wine from their extensive list. But the beautiful ambiance, and kind and attentive service made the experience sublime. We are grateful to the whole staff for such a memorable evening.

original_text: Wow! Rarely do I start a review with a wow, but this one deserves it. Traditional French bistro atmosphere, but with a welcoming vibe. The service is excellent, unrushed, attentive and helpful and friendly. The food while simple was perfectly executed. Escargot perfect, roasted half chicken with creamed potatoes and confit of duck leg and roasted potatoes. Ile flottane for dessert just perfect, excellent wine list. And the restaurant is located just across from the seine river. This is a must stop.

And the restaurant is located just across from the seine river. This is a must stop.

original_text: A most wonderful experience. From the time you walk in to the time you leave. We visited for our 40th wedding anniversary. I’m a vegetarian and so surprised that they conformed dishes to suit me. We had the best experience. We will visit again and again. Highly recommend

original_text: Dinner june24. Pros: none. Cons: food arrived under 60 seconds after ordering. spit roast chicken was cold and so tough it couldn’t be eaten. Must have cooked much earlier that day, and left to warm. No questions asked by waiter why the food hadn’t been touched.

original_text: We went last Wednesday for lunch, it was a rainy day which kind of bummed us out when seeing the city. Our lunch here became the highlight of our day ! The servers (Rick and Jeremy I believe) were so nice and accommodating to us specially we don’t know how to speak French. Made us feel at home during a rainy/gloomy day in Paris. The food was amazing especially the desserts ! Definitely one of the best food experience we had in Paris! Also love the interior design of the place ! We sat by the window area. Merci!

original_text: Came a few weeks ago for lunch together with my girlfriend as we were visiting Paris. Food was authentically French and delicious, the staff was so friendly and professional at the same time. Had one of best lunch ever and the price was very honest for the quality of the food and the service. I am still dreaming the delicious duck. Will go back!

original_text: If you want a traditional French restaurant this is the place to go! One of best restaurants in Paris! I’ve been to Paris many times and this was my first time here and my family and I loved it!! Casa and the whole staff were amazing! Very kind, accommodating and welcoming! Everything was great! Definitely recommend and will come back everytime I come to Paris now!

original_text: Today we have finally tasted Rotisserie d’Argent in our first night at Paris and you might want to hear what I have to say. We arrived at the restaurant after long day walking in Paris, quite tired yet we were very excited to try out delicious food and excellent to end this long day. So the waiter asked me what would we like to drink and I asked if they had any sweet white wine so he suggested Sauternes. It was sweet, better than we thought and my favorite. Sadly, it was the last one and it wasn’t cold, like the waiter said so knowing that, I asked politely to bring a glass with ice in order to drink it as cold as possible and at the same time we ordered food which was: Oeuf (egg, potato and mayonnaise, very delicious by the way), Epaule d’Agneau and Demi Poule. After finishing the Entrée, we were a quarter way of finishing the wine bottle yet the glass with ice haven’t arrived yet so I asked again politely the waiter to please, if I could get the glass of ice. Time went on and we finished the bottle so when we got the waiter’s attention if we could get another bottle of the same wine and he said that was the last one so we asked a champagne. The ice still has not arrived which I asked for the third time to the waiter the glass with ice which he finally did bring the glass of ice with the champagne, even though it was supposed to be for the last wine. When I thought things could not get worse, from the first dish that was served at 19:30 (photo timestamp), we were waiting and waiting, other customers who came 30 mins later ordered and got served, we were still waiting and waiting. I have even asked the waiter where was the food with a sign and he told me to wait. Around 20:30, the food finally came, it had very good looks and excellent presentation but we were done waiting, we lost the appetite and I told the waiter if I could talk to his manager. He did not respond and left. 3 minutes went by and nobody came so I had to get up, find him and ask him politely if I could talk to the manager which he finally told someone to take responsibility of what happened as we just wanted to leave as fast as we could since that was the worst experience I ever had on any restaurant. Finally, the waiter removed the food which we left uneaten and we paid for the two bottles of wine (less than half unfinished champagne), Oeuf (very delicious dish) and two glasses of water. I expected to get a reduced rate for the service but I did not and I feel very disappointed on how good food can be ruined so badly from the service I got. I am never coming back again.

original_text: One of the best restaurants in Paris. Amazing food, atmosphere and service. Everyone who works there is so nice, welcoming and accommodating. Highly recommend. A bit on the pricier side but for the quality of the food, atmosphere, location, service and whole experience it is worth it and priced well

original_text: Great atmosphere and a good place to meet some friends. The whole duck for two is amazing, both legs and chest cooked perfectly.

original_text: I was there for lunch. The combination of that incredible view, the equally incredible wine cellar, the excellent food and perfect service adds up to the best lunch ever. Expensive, but worth every penny.

original_text: We went here for dinner and had a wonderful evening. A classic French bistro with very good service. We had the prime rib for two and it was absolutely delicious, with a homemade whipped béarnaise sauce and the very nice crispy fries.

original_text: We were there for our 9 month wedding anniversary, and had a table with a spectacular view of the river at sunset. Can’t say enough about the experience. It was all we were hoping for- and more.

original_text: Absolutely one of the best dinners/venues we have ever experienced! The food was perfectly prepared, the view of the river just spectacular and the overall ambiance delightful.

original_text: I know of Tour d’Argent from the 1st ever Collaboration with French Laundry in Napa Valley, California. I had reasonably high expectations for the quality of food and service at the Rôtisserie. The menu offered a Ribeye that was so tough the serrated knife could not cut through it. The server opened the best bottle of Champagne on the menu and did not wait to allow the tasting. He also talked me off ordering the duck confit and onto the Veal, which was in a delicious sauce, however, were not veal medallions but veal kidneys. I understand that it is my responsibility to understand the French menu, however, my 16 lessons of French did not render the word, “kidney” into my new French vocabulary. Most of the chicken dishes were also delicious, and one was dry. My effort to show my party of 8 a great dining experience with the sister Tour d’Argent was a failure. Although I was very much looking forward to dining at the newly remodeled d’Argent, this experience indicates that some “kinks” still might need to worked out. Overall, disappointing.

original_text: Lovely, quaint bistro with delicious food. We dined at lunch time and the quality of food was exceptional. Good portion sizes and the restaurant had a very cosy atmosphere. All the staff were very friendly from the second we walked in. Shout out to our waiter Hamid who was very friendly and made great suggestions on what we should order, he was very pleasant and made our experience great.

original_text: The casual dining arm of the famed Tour d'Argent. The warm welcome and chatty Maitre'd Cedric personifies French service! I'll try for the original one day! Fab food, service, atmosphere! I'll be back.

original_text: The duck tastes great! However, the salad is a bit too sour for me.
text: The duck tastes great! However, the salad is a bit too sour for me.

original_text: Nice service, efficient and friendly. The indoor venue was cozy like a bistro. Menu was small but varied. Prices were high for the place but the dishes were tasty and portions were big. Very nice roadted chicken and asparragus. The fish appetizer and the porc were delicious too. Nice wine pitchers, otherwise the bottles were a bit expensive but good selection. Overall, a nice option for lunch in an upscale (food-wise) kind of brasserie.

Overall, a nice option for lunch in an upscale (food-wise) kind of brasserie.

Not very busy during weekdays and the staff is very friendly. Totally recommend this restaurant for traditional food

original_text: After receiving a recommendation we made reservations. Considering the name of the restaurant, we ordered the roast chicken and the fish. The fish was lovely with a light medley of vegetables. Unfortunately the chicken meat was inedibly dry, including the dark meat (quite a feat). The potatoes were very good. We expected a perfectly cooked chicken from "La Rotisserie". Service was on point and the window seating was great.

Unfortunately the chicken meat was inedibly dry, including the dark meat (quite a feat). The potatoes were very good. We expected a perfectly cooked chicken from "La Rotisserie". Service was on point and the window seating was great.

original_text: This is rotisserie of the famous Tour d’Argent restaurant, which is closed for reformation at the moment. The food is excellent. My favorite plate is veal kidneys with old fashioned mustard and mashed potatoes. Staff is friendly and attentive. They can recommend a good vine for any dish you choose. Nice view of the rive I front of the restaurant

original_text: Dining at La Tour d'Argent was a decades-long dream come true. Our lunch there was the one of the most exceptional dining experiences I have ever had. The entire team, from the moment we entered, was warm, welcoming and in perfect coordination with each other, like a well-choreographed performance. The gorgeous dining room with its spectacular view was a "wow" moment. For the meal, instead of looking at the options, we chose to be "surprised" by the menu items in our 4 courses, and we were delighted by each exquisitely prepared and presented offering. The various servers and the sommelier were attentive to every detail and made sure we were pleased every step of the way. We felt as if we were valued guests. Yes, it is expensive, but for an experience of a lifetime it was a worthy investment in a lasting memory.

original_text: Great hospitality and generous welcome. One of the best foie-gras Ive eaten, and enfoie-graschampagne produced by La tour d'Argent from Grand-cru village and the family Legras. Paired beaufiully with thier famous duck We ended the decadent lunch with chocolate mousse and the perfect creme brulee. The Cahors -malbec grappe from 2019 paired beautifully and from Domaine Causse- Neuve was areally good deal for 68€. The Maître D'hotel Mr. Wallid was kind and attentive.We also well tended to by Amid, who happily took excellent care for our English speaking guest. I truly reccomend the resturuant and wish them much more well earned sucess.

original_text: An amazing experience! A classic French dining and we were celebrating so it was the perfect pick! The egg appetizer is beyond words… do not pass it up. It is their specialty and once you taste it, you will see why. The duck confit is perfection and their steak with pepper sauce was delicious and then match it with their expansive wine list.. you can’t go wrong. Now make such you leave room for dessert!! The floating island is simply amazing!!! Light and airy you can’t stop until it’s gone. And the team there is so nice and welcoming…. They made our celebration perfect!

original_text: I contacted management with my feedback and they ignored me multiple times. Not a good sign. This review is for La Rôtisserie d'Argent (more casual) and not for La Tour d'Argent (formal). Many Google reviews are mixing up these two places. The service staff were friendly and welcoming time permitted. Food-wise, we had the duck for two which was well cooked, but portioned more for 3-4 people and not possible to finish. We ordered two portions of the roast chicken both of which were dry and inedible. The chef even inspected our uneaten chicken and chose to ignore a clear problem with the food. Very disappointed at the chicken and management response. Would recommend to avoid this restaurant.

original_text: Service was excellent. I ordered beef, it is very soft and beef taste very strong. Snails taste good enough too. My dessert was ice-cream, the nugget flavour is a surprise and taste very good too. Everything are pretty good. It is a French restaurant, I wish one day they have the pressed-duck dish again. In my experience over 17 countries, overall 4.6 score from me. Very well. Keep it up.

original_text: Wonderful food experience. The best place to have conard au sang. Strict dress code. Gentlemen must be there with their shirts & jackets. No shorts no sneakers are allowed.
text: Wonderful food experience. The best place to have conard au sang. Strict dress code. Gentlemen must be there with their shirts & jackets. No shorts no sneakers are allowed.

Dining at La Tour d'Argent was nothing short of a dream come true. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable—attentive yet never intrusive. The staff orchestrated a seamless dining experience, allowing us to savor every moment in the enchanting ambiance with a breathtaking view of Notre Dame. The wine experience, curated by the exceptionally knowledgeable sommelier, was truly spectacular. We started with a 2007 Puligny-Montrachet Clavoillon, which was deliciously nuanced and set the perfect tone for the evening. However, the true star was the 1989 Gevrey-Chambertin Cazetiers, a legendary wine that surpassed all expectations. Each sip was a revelation, perfectly complementing the exquisite dishes prepared by Chef Yannick. As a professional chef with thirty years of experience, I was thoroughly impressed with the innovative renditions of the classics. The thoughtful preparations, attention to detail, and use of the highest quality ingredients showcased Chef Yannick’s exceptional talent and dedication. Every course was a masterpiece, beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The view of Notre Dame added a magical touch to an already perfect evening. The combination of outstanding service, phenomenal food, and extraordinary wine made for an unforgettable experience. La Tour d'Argent is a place where culinary dreams come true, and I am thrilled to have crossed it off my bucket list.

original_text: My first visit to La Tour d’Argent on New Year’s Eve. We made the choice to leave the year 2021 behind, to start 2022 for the better new year. We arrived at 8 pm. On the ground floor, they were many staff welcoming us to the restaurant which I think La Tour d’Argent isn’t just a restaurant but they pack with all the legendary clients photos and clients signature cards collection on the wall heading to the elevator , I am feeling, I was walking into a place full with the legendary guests on the wall. I am feeling so special to be able to come so far from home to Paris. We took the elevator up to the restaurant area with a live singer and band playing music all night, very festive! We have the set menu for new year and i am glad to have this: every dish is so so fresh and delicious. Let me tell you about the service, the staff are very friendly, they know not to interrupt you during all the night and also made everything so smooth, I am feeling comfortable and enjoy food although conversation like sitting at my own home.

original_text: A previous review is correct - this is the bistro across the street and not the Michelin star restaurant. We went for a late lunch. Service was good, food was good - classic French bistro (think roast chicken, duck sausage, snails, etc) - but a bit pricy.

original_text: Great food and service! Loved the atmosphere there! Very cozy! Highly recommend!
text: Great food and service! Loved the atmosphere there! Very cozy! Highly recommend!

original_text: AMAZING! One of the best meals of my life. Fabulous service, amazing river views sitting outside by the bridge, food was incredible (we had the duck fillet and catch of the day, cod) and wine was superb. Nothing short of the perfect meal.
text: AMAZING! One of the best meals of my life. Fabulous service, amazing river views sitting outside by the bridge, food was incredible (we had the duck fillet and catch of the day, cod) and wine was superb. Nothing short of the perfect meal.

original_text: The best roast chicken we have ever had in our entire lives! The sauce it comes with is divine and the mashed potatoes compliment perfectly. A must if you are in Paris!

original_text: Cute little bistro by the river with nice food, cozy ambience and welcoming staff. We love the white apparagus, leek, veal kidney and beef tartar. The duck was flavorful but slightly tough. The bill added up to 262€ for 5 pax with a bottle of wine.
text: Cute little bistro by the river with nice food, cozy ambience and welcoming staff. We love the white apparagus, leek, veal kidney and beef tartar. The duck was flavorful but slightly tough. The bill added up to 262€ for 5 pax with a bottle of wine.

original_text: Absolutely one of the worst dining experiences I’ve had in Paris for the price. The staff were non-existent and when present, hopeless. No water offered, waited 20 minutes upon sitting down to be offered anything. The ceasar salad (€36) was inedible. See photos. Drenched in a dressing, brown and sad salad leaves, the shrimp was raw in some parts and not cleaned in others with the shrimp intestinal track still there. Disgusting and a rip off. After telling one of the wait staff I had finished with my beer I watched it sit on my table for an hour. Just no interest, care and terrible quality service all round. The mains were very badly cooked. Kidney was swimming in a sickeningly sweet mustard sauce and the chicken was over cooked and potatoes drenched in oil. For over €200 for 2 people just for food, this was absolutely terrible. Don’t waste your time.

original_text: Always such a nice experience. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating. Of course, the food is fabulous and the presentation is delightful. An essential part of our Paris visits.

original_text: We came to this restaurant under the pretence that it was the sister restaurant of the highly rated La Tour D’argent. We expected much higher standard than what was experienced. The service was lacking attention and connection with the us the patron. The food was dreadful and very ordinary - the steak was very tough and not a good cut of meat (I could not eat it), the chicken was tasteless and dry, the fries were burnt and they didn’t even bring bread. The only good thing was the wine however most of what was on the list weren’t available. The pièce de résistance was the mouse running by our feet 😳 I wish I had got a photo of that to post! We were going to complain but I don’t think the wait staff would have understood. Also expensive for what you got 165eu Overall the most terrible experience I’ve had in a restaurant anywhere!!!

original_text: Fantastic place with amazing food and and view. Service was excellent right until we should get our coats when nobody was there. Small another tip: Prepare a shorter wine list that contains a set of recommendations for the different dishes. The big wine list is impressive, but very massive and cumbersome to review.

original_text: We had lunch on 05/25/2024, four of us. Service was very slow. We waited for 45 minutes our order. Tables next to us were served long before. The server drop all the french fries bowl on the table and never care to clean or replace anything. After 20 minutes, we reminded him to please take care of the incident. I decided to speak to the manager and express my displeasure to them. I would not be back at all.

I decided to speak to the manager and express my displeasure to them. I would not be back at all.

original_text: We came here for our 30th anniversary. We were somewhat disappointed at the disjointed service. When we arrived there was a lot of staff, but it was never clear throughout the evening who was actually taking care of us. By the end of the night just a few employees were left and we had to go find someone to ask for the check. The wine was delicious, but the food and service were unfortunately just average. A disappointment since this was one of my husbands "bucket list" restaurants. The staff were kind, but not particularly warm and there didn't seem to be a system in place. We've been to Michelin starred restaurants that excel at the "experience" unfortunately this wasn't one of them. For a $1200 dinner it should be fairly seamless.

original_text: Best escargot! What a quaint French experience with the most friendly and welcoming atmosphere!

original_text: Warm welcome, friendly and attentive service, solid food, cosy room. Portion size was OK, prices were quite high. I was not dissatisfied with the meal itself but neither will it prove to be particularly memorable. I do think the restaurant overcharges for what you actually receive on the plate.

original_text: Excellent service and food. Escargots were great. Very creative mini-sardines. Pigeon roasted was a great surprise even served medium-rare. Beef rib is big, and served well my wife and two kids.

original_text: Overrated, overpriced, haphazard service and mediocre food. Kidneys not cored, sweated not sautéed. Net very bad. Waiter did not check on meal and brought side dish half way through lunch. Give this place a miss.

original_text: Surprisingly average. With all of the other fabulous restaurants in Paris, we wouldn’t return. Steak was not good. Chicken was good but nothing special. Best thing we had was the deviled eggs and frites.

original_text: Perfect place for trying Parisian cuisine. They have an award-winning egg maonnaise and the creme brullee could win some awards too. Excellent service and impressive kitchen.

original_text: Excellent french diner with duck speciality. Steaks also very good. Helaas doesn't serve pressed canard.

original_text: It's a good restaurant, but not the memorable one I expected being part of La Tour d'Argent group. The food is good, but as good as many other places. The foie gras wasn't particularly exciting. Correct, but probably the best part was the Sauternes. The roasted veal with morels sauce was very flavourful, but the meat was a bit rubbery. The service was very kind at all times, but they could take some time to come back and check the table, even when the restaurant was almost empty. The atmosphere was quite solemn, at least at night, close to closing. I don't regret having dined here, but I won't be dreaming about it.

original_text: From the moment we approached the front door we were treated as special guests of the owner. The food was impeccable and served by truly professional service attendants. The new decor is bright and invigorating and of course the view is terrific.
text: From the moment we approached the front door we were treated as special guests of the owner. The food was impeccable and served by truly professional service attendants. The new decor is bright and invigorating and of course the view is terrific.

original_text: My mother and I had a wonderful dinner at La Rotisserie d’Argent. The chicken, salmon, white asparagus, baguette, and crème brûlée were all delicious. The staff were incredibly helpful and kind, and went above and beyond by offering to change my mom’s order without charge after we mistranslated her initial order. The mistake was entirely ours, and we truly appreciated the way the staff wanted to ensure we had a good dining experience regardless. The charming and classic dining atmosphere, delicious food, and excellent service made for a relaxing dinner - would recommend!

The mistake was entirely ours, and we truly appreciated the way the staff wanted to ensure we had a good dining experience regardless. The charming and classic dining atmosphere, delicious food, and excellent service made for a relaxing dinner - would recommend!

original_text: A wonderful experience. Sadly the view of Notre Dame was not quite so wonderful as our original visit in 1974, because of the ongoing repair work. The service was professional and kind. The food exquisite.
text: A wonderful experience. Sadly the view of Notre Dame was not quite so wonderful as our original visit in 1974, because of the ongoing repair work. The service was professional and kind. The food exquisite.

original_text: As always lunch at the Tour d’Argent is a prime experience of Parisian life. The elegance and spaciousness and spirit of the place allows for full appreciation of the cuisine together with the congeniality of one’s assembled company. As one aged in years beyond a true ability to digest a meal of Lucullan proportions, I would prefer a more modest selection à la carte, but this is a small reservation against so much enjoyment.
text: As always lunch at the Tour d’Argent is a prime experience of Parisian life. The elegance and spaciousness and spirit of the place allows for full appreciation of the cuisine together with the congeniality of one’s assembled company. As one aged in years beyond a true ability to digest a meal of Lucullan proportions, I would prefer a more modest selection à la carte, but this is a small reservation against so much enjoyment.

original_text: Overall, a great experience. The duck was exquisite. History of this place is mind-blowing & we had a beautiful view of the River Seine. We had the tasting menu. They failed to ask about any food allergies however which is surprising considering the calibre of the restaurant. Even the most basic restaurants always ask this question. I let the server know of my shell fish allergy & they did accommodate for us eventually, however, not without causing a minor raucous. Also caused a minor raucous that we did not drink alcohol & declined the champagne. The restaurant could improve with acknowledging & being prepared people's different food & lifestyle preferences, otherwise a great experience.

original_text: We thought we had booked at the restaurant across the street (Tour d'Argent), but were pleasantly surprised. The food was great (rotisserie chicken with garlic, a mushroom starter, creme brulee), and our bank account thanks us.

original_text: nice experience however, the terrace is on the street near a busy road over the Seine. the wine list has not been replenished, many bottles are therefore unavailable
text: nice experience however, the terrace is on the street near a busy road over the Seine. the wine list has not been replenished, many bottles are therefore unavailable

original_text: Once in a lifetime experience so it's difficult to rank appropriately. Obviously the aesthetics and service were unbelievable. Definitely feels like a three Michelin star white glove experience. The duck courses were fantastic and highly unusual which was a rare plus. The wine list is larger than an encyclopedia and is thrilling. All wines are at least 100 euros but given that, honestly, the selection of 20+ year old wine under 200 euros is impressive. The cheese cart and desserts are both can't miss items. Not for every visit to Paris but at least once in a lifetime!

The wine list is larger than an encyclopedia and is thrilling. All wines are at least 100 euros but given that, honestly, the selection of 20+ year old wine under 200 euros is impressive. The cheese cart and desserts are both can't miss items. Not for every visit to Paris but at least once in a lifetime!

original_text: It is very difficult to even begin this superlative recommendation. The greeting upon arrival, the pre-dinner cocktail, the location close to a very active and well staffed kitchen, the presentation of the beautiful duck, its preparation, the owner’s visit, the general manager’s attention, our faithful duck table companion, and the view of night construction at Notre Dame! And that is only the beginning of our impressions of D’Argent. Scrumptious food is beautifully prepared by the ballet team in the kitchen and presented by a very well trained and courteous group of out-front presentation staff…. Just watching our duck presented and then prepared at the table was amazing. Canard surgery at its best, with the final preparation a masterpiece. What a pleasure, what a night, and oh, the wine was very French, very bold, and very good… We were very lucky to have enjoyed such a wonderful night with so many thoughtful and talented food professionals… Thank you, John and Sandy

original_text: Best meal I had in Paris. Everything was perfection. The wait staff were exceptional. Got a small glimpse of the kitchen because the normal lift for the restaurant was broken. That was neat. It felt like we were being let in a secret VIP entrance. A night I will remember.

original_text: We had a lovely dinner . The view is the best part of this restaurant and the service is exceptional but can be a little intimidating. Food was very good and the little extras were great, but overall overpriced for what you get.

original_text: Not the Tour d'Argent so no view of the river, relaxed not formal service etc *but* cheaper food, still high quality, and good wine list. Our bottle of 'house brand' burgundy was excellent value at around 40 euro, for example. Lovely meal, with perfectly cooked duck breast and beef fillet, and lemon tart & crème brûlée that could not be faulted. Highly *highly* recommended.

original_text: Fantastic french bistro with 5 stars classic french fare. Had a whole duck served as two courses which was spectacular. Best to get there with an empty stomach. Highly recommended

original_text: On our recent trip to Paris we decided to try La Tour d'Argent and it did not dissapoint. We arrived 30 minutes early in order to enjoy a cocktail in their ground floor reception area. The drinks and service were perfect. Attentive and delicious. Once we decided to dine we were escorted upstairs to our table, a parfect location where we could enjoy the view as well as see into the open kitchen. Both my wife and I decided to try the 5 course chef's "surprise" tasting menu and it was wonderful. Cluade, the effucive and personable sommelier paired a perfect "pre-dinner" glass of white, a phenominal red which matched all of the food, and a delicious after dinner digestif.

original_text: One of the best restaurants in Paris. Everything cooked to perfection. Roasted chicken awesome. Beef with peppercorn to die for. The pike is what I always get. The best in the world. Servers are nice. Friendly. Funny. Must go if your near the notre dame!

original_text: La perfection 👌🏻 This is perfection ! The only possible comment on this experience ! It was my dream to enjoy a meal at this epic place, institution I would say. And dreams come true. Amazing experience. Over the top. The service, the view, the food ! 5*!

original_text: We were very disappointed by our visit… the food was below average - dry chicken and duck that was just a pain to cut with their dull knives. The cherry on top was the price. Not recommended at all, a shame since the service and atmosphere were pleasant.

original_text: Good food, good service, and reasonable prices. My personal recommendation would have to be the escargots, although the half duck is also delicious. But don't forget to leave some space for dessert, as the creme Brulee and the raspberry tartalette are incredible.
text: Good food, good service, and reasonable prices. My personal recommendation would have to be the escargots, although the half duck is also delicious. But don't forget to leave some space for dessert, as the creme Brulee and the raspberry tartalette are incredible.

original_text: What wonderful ambiance and service! We enjoyed a delightful evening on the terrace. Our waiter, Justin, was gracious and very helpful.
text: What wonderful ambiance and service! We enjoyed a delightful evening on the terrace. Our waiter, Justin, was gracious and very helpful.

original_text: We had an exceptional experience at the Tour d'Argent one Saturday evening. The view was perfect — we were seated by the window — and everything we ordered was delicious. They have one of the most impressive wine cellars in the world. The wine list was literally the size of an encyclopaedia. The sommelier knew it by heart and recommended the perfect pairings, which were not necessarily the most expensive bottles on the list. Tour d'Argent is obviously very, very pricey, but it's a once in a lifetime experience, best shared with amazing company to complement the setting, the service and the food.

The sommelier knew it by heart and recommended the perfect pairings, which were not necessarily the most expensive bottles on the list. Tour d'Argent is obviously very, very pricey, but it's a once in a lifetime experience, best shared with amazing company to complement the setting, the service and the food.
Excellent experience and food.

original_text: Great dinning experience, the staff was very welcoming and accommodating for our toddler which made the experience even better. Would recommend to anyone visiting Paris for good food in a welcoming establishment.

original_text: Perfection. We have dined at 3 Michelin Star restaurants and this exceeds those experiences. We dined at La Tour D’Argent in 2001 and it was perfection then and perfection now.

original_text: Thanks to Quentin our dinner was outstanding ! Great wine suggestion and fantastic service. The traditional food was exactly what we expected from a true typical Parisian restaurant.
text: Thanks to Quentin our dinner was outstanding ! Great wine suggestion and fantastic service. The traditional food was exactly what we expected from a true typical Parisian restaurant.

original_text: Top service and even better food. Worth the price, we had the canneton for two served in two services, the half black legged chicken (they even gave us an extra serving of the roasting juice!!) And the half crossed duck from Challans. We were so stuffed at the end that we didn't even had dessert. Their bread is top notch as well. Imo the canneton was the best so go in pairs.

original_text: Every moment at La Tour D'argent was excellent. From the moment we walked through the door, we were welcomed with efficient and friendly staff. We are fun people who enjoy good food, wine and a fun ambience (lots of laughter) and at La Tour D'argent, it's all in abundance :). We enjoyed the four course tasting menu, with lost of different amuse bouche and palate cleansers in between; all totally delicious. Not forgetting the wonderful Sommeliers and their HUGE wine bible; we thank you. We will most definitely be visiting again and have already earmarked April 2025. Hopefully, on our next visit the chief will not have to cut my food up..... long story!

We are fun people who enjoy good food, wine and a fun ambience (lots of laughter) and at La Tour D'argent, it's all in abundance :). We enjoyed the four course tasting menu, with lost of different amuse bouche and palate cleansers in between; all totally delicious. Not forgetting the wonderful Sommeliers and their HUGE wine bible; we thank you. We will most definitely be visiting again and have already earmarked April 2025. Hopefully, on our next visit the chief will not have to cut my food up..... long story!

original_text: The duck confit was delicious. The house Graves was the best wine we had on our trip. The service was initially good. So what went wrong? 1. There was no itemized bill. The manager simply approached us with a card reader and pointed it at us with the total amount. 2. The bill seemed high, but I didn't question it. 3. The manager asked if we wanted to leave a tip, and suggested 20%. That triggered a soft alarm in my head, given standard French practices regarding service charges, but I didn't protest. 4. I didn't realize it until later, but he actually charged us 30%. Thinking about it later, I am certain that the bill already included the service charge, but because we were not given an itemized bill I had no way to check. I also suspect that not everyone is approached for a 20% tip, and if it was on top of the standard service charge, that is an especially serious problem. Finally, the manager adding 30% to the bill might have been an honest mistake, but the bill presentation left me feeling that we had been "touristed." I wrote to management, but have not received a response, let alone an explanation or apology. If you go, be on your guard. Ask to see the bill before you pay, and politely decline any attempt to solicit an extra tip over and above the standard service charge. I was a sucker, but you don't have to be.

Ask to see the bill before you pay, and politely decline any attempt to solicit an extra tip over and above the standard service charge. I was a sucker, but you don't have to be.

original_text: I would like to first note that right from the beginning we felt extremely welcomed by all of the wonderful attendants at Tour d’Argent. We were given the pleasure of comfort and leisure to make for a night we could always remember. We were provided the best table and were so happy to view our last night in Paris overlooking your beautiful city. We had eaten at 3 Michelin restaurants in Paris one of which was Le Meurice. We had been so pleased by the welcoming nature of every place including Tour d’Argent. The waitress was so kind to our daughter and presented each dish excellently. Unfortunately, we quickly lost our experience just following the presentation of the great and extensive wine collection by the Sommelier who had a tattoo of a cross in the back of his neck. We asked for his opinion regarding pairing our wine with our pescatarian selection since it was Friday during Lent. The Sommelier simply told us one white wine we should have for our first and said something under his breath. He did not come back to our table and we were without wine for the next course. After his first presentation, we did not see him again despite him standing at the front talking with the other staff in a full restaurant, and rather the young gentleman who had been serving our water, came to our table to ask us for what we wanted for our next wine. He presented the big book again as if he was a Sommelier. We know a Sommelier is identified by their pin and extensive knowledge even though he presented himself and one. The young gentlemen could not describe any of the wines. We informed him that the Sommelier was supposed to have wine selection for us. The young gentleman proceeded to tell us that he was here to help and we should get red wine for the meat course even though we were suppose to have a fish menu. He brought out the book again but this time showed us the front page and said this is what you have available by the glass. We let him know that we were planning on having fish, but he had said that we were going to have meat and should select a red wine next not a white wine. We were confused at this point, and decided to go with his recommendation for the red wine. However, when our main course was presented, it was the fish selection. Therefore, the red wine, which was very bold, not at all paired with our food selection. In fact, we were very disappointed in how it overrode the delicate preparation of the chefs cuisine. We knew better but decided to take the guidance of your staff. We have dealt with many Sommeliers and have visited Michelin starred restaurants all over the world. We have had only one other experience that was poorly executed by the Sommelier like the one here with the cross on his neck. The shame is that this role in the orchestrating of a great dinner is just as important as the chef preparing the food or the wait staff presenting the cuisine. We highly respect their wine expertise and appreciate their guidance in bringing us the best notes from the wines they often select for us. I prefer their recommendations because they are the experts. Everyone at Tour d’Argent did their part except him and it was further misguided by the waiter who served water and had no idea what our dinner was or the wine selections. The billing did not match our wine selection which was corrected. In the end, I would have expected we would not have paid for the red wine at all considering we informed the staff and the new Sommelier that we were told to select bold reds with the light fish prepared for us. We also did not drink the wine recommended. I emailed twice to Monsieur André Terrai without a reply. Unfortunately, this is a restaurant for the view and not for the experience.

original_text: The food was was fantastic! Service was wonderful. Could not have asked for a better experience in Paris on our final night. What a way to end out week here as we travel to London.
text: The food was was fantastic! Service was wonderful. Could not have asked for a better experience in Paris on our final night. What a way to end out week here as we travel to London.

original_text: Wonderful duck two ways! The service was very attentive. We ordered the duck for two (for three of us). You can see your duck roasting on their rotisserie grilling wall. Once it’s ready they bring it out for you to see before carving it. The first course was slices of the roasted duck. The skin was crispy with an assortment of spices. The meat was moist and cooked medium rare. The red wine soaked plum added fruitiness. The diced potatoes with nuts and parsley was buttery with a nice crunch. The second course was more of a confit of the remaining duck. The gravy was the highlight here. We also ordered the escargot which was good as expected. Would recommend a visit during your stay in Paris! Bon appetit!

Would recommend a visit during your stay in Paris! Bon appetit!

original_text: Cannot recommend enough! Casa was our waiter and helped us with our selections. We had the World Class Egg, Fromages, duck confit, chicken Caesar salad, and chicken with mashed potatoes. We almost ordered the beef but since the duck is their specialty we got that and were not disappointed! The French fries were the right crunchiness - delicious! The only regret is not saving room for the crème brûlée. We will come back on our next trip.

original_text: The food was good but not exceptional compared to other bistros we ate at. Portions are much larger than they need to be which might sound good but left feeling we had to waste food or overeat - seemed unusual for a French restaurant. What ruined the meal was the waiter insisting at the end that gratuity was not included despite it clearly saying on the menu that it was. Assuming they did this because we did not speak French. I said i understood that gratuity was included and he insisted no and then added 20% to the bill himself and ran my card. It felt like a tourist rip off. We enjoyed other bistros and several Michelin stared restaurants all had better food and better service. Interesting to go eat at an historic restaurant but not worth it. We felt like we were ripped off.

original_text: Although this was not my first time eating at La Rotisserie D’Argent, it was my first outdoor dining experience there. The early June weather seemed primed for a meal on the terrasse (terrace). This is set up on the northwest corner of Quai de la Tournelle and Pont de la Tournelle, one of the bridges connecting the city to Ile St. Louis. Born out of the pandemic, the outdoor location now seems to be an established extension of the restaurant during good weather. The bridge’s wide sidewalk provides space for two and four top tables. Wooden planter boxes give a sense of separation from the foot and car traffic. The tables next to the bridge railing have an unobstructed view of the Seine, Ile St. Louis, Notre Dame, and, alas, the reconstruction works and equipment. When the sun begins to set, however, the view is enchanting! My friend and I had dinner on the terrace for our first and last restaurant meals in Paris. The first night’s dinner started with a La Rotisserie’s version of the French classic eggs and mayonnaise, followed by perfectly cooked sea bream. Our food was well prepared and delicious, especially the chilled white asparagus and Chartreuse sauce that was the starter for our final dinner. We didn’t know if Chartreuse was an ingredient or referred to the color of the sauce. Regardless, it was so good that we didn’t let a drop go waste and used bread to capture all of it. My friend’s request for a vegetarian main course resulted in a delightful mélange of eggplant and tomatoes accompanied by haricots verts, grilled baby hearts of romaine, and little roasted potatoes. I thoroughly enjoyed my glazed pork belly and shitake mushrooms, as well as the silky carrot ginger puree that complemented them. The service was professional and attentive, and we were astonished with how much work is involved serving dinner on the bridge. The waiters constantly cross Quai de la Tournelle, a busy street that separates the restaurant from the terrace. They must carry everything back and forth: all of the food and drink and trays heavily laden with used dishes, glasses, and silverware. It’s helpful to keep this in mind if it takes a little longer than expected to receive your meal or drinks. Although the outdoor area must close by 10 p.m., those who wish to linger over dessert or a digestif can do so inside the restaurant. I understand that La Rotisserie’s sister restaurant and near neighbor, La Tour D’Argent, offers a notable perspective of the river and Notre Dame from its sixth floor location. However, after my latest visits to La Rotisserie it’s difficult to imagine how seeing that view through a glass window could compare to a picture perfect summer dinner on the bridge.

original_text: #40 follow my Michelin Stars Marathon reviews on Googlemaps list On top of the world! If you’re French, sitting in la Tour d Argent, you’re feeling like you’re on top of the world… and you are since you have a magnificent view over, what we French consider as the world: Paris and Notre Dame. I know what you’re going to say: it’s expensive. You’re right. It is. Is it really though ? The lunch menu is less than a very average 3 stars hotel in the city center. Which memories will last a lifetime? A meal at La Tour or an hotel night in a very average place? I had the good fortune of speaking with the manager of the group (they also have a bakery -aka “oh my god those croissants are so good”, and an epicerie ). Interestingly, the difference with the others famous star Michelin in Paris, is that the proportion of none Parisian French customers is uniquely higher, allowing them to reopen way before the other big names. It does make sense. I wouldn’t live in Paris, why wouldn’t I eat in a place where I enjoy Paris, a great cuisine and an impeccable service? Still, for the French, we save this restaurant for the “grandes occasions”, exceptional events like engagement, diplomas, etc… well, I’m living 2 mn walk from the place, I feel like I need to more exceptional event in my life… So when I went, the restaurant patrons were mainly French, which is really different from other place I went (see my review on Septime). To make it short, if you want to be amongst wealthy French, now you know the address. Which brings me to another point: the dressing code/mood. You ll receive an email after you booked reminding you that you should dress properly. Well, I think it’s important because I think there are places, where it’s great when all the patrons are well dressed. Being well dressed, it’s not only important for your experience, but also for the others, as you’re participating in creating an unique memory. I would feel as I m not respecting the other patrons (especially the couples) moment by not dressing up. I saw some French guy in chic, yet slightly casual, I was about to call the fashion police on them! One last thing, don’t worry about it being to « formal « , the waiters will know how to put you at ease. It’s the quality of all the good Michelin Stars waiters, nice enough to be at ease, distant enough to feel respected. Here you have la crème de la crème. But what about the food, I hear you wondering. It’s true that the setting, the history and the service will first occupy your mind. But then, you wonder if the cuisine will be up to the same level. The task is incredibly difficult. You went to be classical, yet haute cuisine, with some innovations (but not too much). The chef, who is a “meilleur ouvrier de France “ (like “top chef”, but before, without cameras and really focus on the cuisine…) manages to avoid the traps, and delivers beautifully. He manages to get out alive of this culinary “mine field “. Look at my pictures. It’s as good as it looks. It’s perfectly executed, coherent, balanced and perfectly in line with the rest of the experience. Which is another fit in itself. It’s a very well deserved star, a top tiers one star. It’ll create memories, that’ll you speak about years later. And I need to find a good reason to go back!

original_text: Everything we had was excellent [escargot, duck, chocolate cake] with the exception of the Ceasar salad with chicken which was fine, but nothing spectacular. Lovely waiter and atmosphere.
text: Everything we had was excellent [escargot, duck, chocolate cake] with the exception of the Ceasar salad with chicken which was fine, but nothing spectacular. Lovely waiter and atmosphere.

original_text: Disappointing experience- the food was overpriced for what it was. My husband ordered lamb and was brought the wrong meal entirely. The steak he was brought was tough and overcooked. My mashed potatoes were hot, but chicken was cold. We expected more and were let down.
text: Disappointing experience- the food was overpriced for what it was. My husband ordered lamb and was brought the wrong meal entirely. The steak he was brought was tough and overcooked. My mashed potatoes were hot, but chicken was cold. We expected more and were let down.

original_text: To be or not to be emotional ... Probably one of the most well known Restaurant in the world : La Tour d'Argent. I have been leaving in Paris since years and never had to real opportunity to go in this restaurant. My first experience was just exceptional and emotional. First the location is simply outstanding downtown Paris with a view of Notre Dame (At the time I am posting the comments the drama of Notre Dame has happened). The river "la Seine" . The charming interior is great and there is a diamond down the building : the cellar is just crazy - an outstanding experience when you take the time to visit and get the all story . Then the service and the dinner were simply all great from the beginning until the end. I did not have the opportunity to try the specialty "Canard au sang" but I will definitively remember this experience. Thank you Chef Philippe Labbé.

original_text: Kassa, our waiter at La Rôtisserie d'Argent, provided exceptional service. His welcoming demeanor and attentive nature made our dining experience truly memorable. From the moment we were seated, Kassa made us feel welcomed and valued as guests. His warm smile and friendly demeanor set a positive tone for the evening. What truly stood out was his exceptional attentiveness throughout the meal. Kassa paid close attention to every detail, ensuring that our dining experience was nothing short of perfect. Thank you / Merci

original_text: Classic French cooking at the very highest level. Beautiful room with a beautiful view. Do not die before coming to this restaurant at least once.
text: Classic French cooking at the very highest level. Beautiful room with a beautiful view. Do not die before coming to this restaurant at least once.

original_text: The La Tour d'Argent is the oldest restaurant in Paris (1582). Impecable and courteous service from the front door to the table. The chef offers a culinary experience. The Gran Livre de Vin is in the true sense of the word "grand". The restaurant over looks the Seine with Notre Dame in the distance. Our time there was very enjoyable and memorable. If I were to something different, I would make a reservation just sunset.

original_text: If you have a chance I strongly recommend to go to this restaurant. They serve traditional duck dish. If you order duck you will get certification card which numbering they served duck. And my favorite one their dish is crape. As I know thief crape is best in the world.

original_text: It was a dream for me as youngster to eat at this monument restaurant located in very authentic Parisienne area, actually it was a dream to many to be in the same restaurant where they ate in it almost all famous kings, presidents and leaders and personalities from around the planet since it was founded in 1582, yes you heard that right since 439 years ago and The location Quai de la Tournelle, where the restaurant stands, was not paved until the year 1650, before which it was "a slope, often flooded and almost always made inaccessible by mud...... I booked 4 months in advance to our trip to Paris and paid a deposit to book the table and here I am with my date my lovely wife We choose our table at the window facing the river and it couldn’t be more romantic than that view, The food was exceptional and the wine list was amazing and I guess one of a kind in the planet since the thickness it was like 2 phone books attached together and the service was outstanding and professional and mostly the butler,,, Obviously We enjoyed the whole evening the appetizers, the main course and the dessert and most of all the 1999 bottle of French wine, After the dinner the manager showed us around where we look at the pictures of kings and presidents has been and ate at this same place (like us) :)

original_text: Wine wine wine wine. We went there twice during our trip. The food is spectacular but you are here for one of the best wine lists the world has seen. Be patient and search carefully as you will find stunners and that you will talk about the rest of your life. original_text: Second night in Paris and we really wanted a good duck experience. We were so pleased with our meal (duck confit, but saw someone who ordered the whole duck and WOW!!) and the whole experience here. Food was amazing, atmosphere was warm and inviting and how I picture traditional French restaurants. Best of all was the service. We had many different individuals checking on us instead of just one individual. And despite our French not being amazing, they were so gracious and didn’t make us feel out of place. Would highly recommend eating here and would dine here again in a heartbeat.

original_text: Very bad staff with no experience in hospitality and service. Your hostess is the pinnacle of rudeness, nusty and not equip to be part of hospitality. She mostly throw us out of the restaurant because (as other guest did also) we complain about waiting more than 20mn to get to our table as we all arrive on time. Unacceptable. It is maybe how you make extra money to park your guest in the Polo room to buy some drinks…. And make them wait. Very cheap approach Food is just ok for the price. Service quite deplorable for this kind of restaurant. And your wine list probably half of the wine you try to sell are too old to be good with astronomic prices. Won’t recommend it And won’t go back Too arrogant of a place and your hostess doesn’t help to make the experience better And please don’t ask stupid questions below. It looks like a fast food survey

original_text: My fiancé and I chose La Rotisserie d’Argent to celebrate our engagement and the experience couldn’t have gone any better. It was my first time in France as well. First, we were running late and they still honored our reservation and seated us right next to where the cooks are so we got watch the food get made which was really cool. After we received our starters and champagne, they offered to move us to a more intimate and quiet table in the corner close to the window since they knew we were celebrating our engagement. We had the prime rib with fries and let me tell you, fries in France are blow American fries out of the water. The staff was friendly and service was superb. The prime rib was enormous and cooked to perfection as well. I couldn’t have asked for a better experience with my first time fine dining in Paris. I recommend this restaurant for both casual dinners and special occasions. They were also very patient with us knowing we didn’t speak French well. 5 out of 5 stars. Well done!

The prime rib was enormous and cooked to perfection as well. I couldn’t have asked for a better experience with my first time fine dining in Paris. I recommend this restaurant for both casual dinners and special occasions. They were also very patient with us knowing we didn’t speak French well. 5 out of 5 stars. Well done!

original_text: We diner here on our last night in Paris late July. It was highly recommended to us. We did enjoy our night however my husband had the beef fillet and asked for it to be cooked medium, it came out very very rare. It was still very tasty but not to his liking. I had the famous chicken which was delicious. Also had the chocolate tart for dessert which I found so very rich, I was unable to finish it. Wish I’d gone for the creme brûlée which was the chefs special that night. All in all was a lovely experience the wait staff were superb super help and friendly Picked a lovely wine for me Just make sure you get your beef cooked we should have sent it back but just chose to eat it anyway 🤔🫤

original_text: Everyone we met here was so helpful and kind. I would very strongly recommend reservations. They went out of their way to help us pick out the food and wine that would best meet our tastes. The managers were very aware of US dining customs (more than we were of French ones) and willing to help us through. The duck for two was amazing, but be sure to bring your appetite as the servings are plentiful. Overall one of the best restaurants I’ve ever been to!

original_text: A wonderful small bistro and sister restaurant of the famous Tour d’Argent. Downscale red/white tablecloths but perfect for a winter lunch or a nice dinner. The roasted chicken and frites is perfect or if more adventerous a full roasted duck perhaps. We started with a cold fois gros and a simple green salad. They also have a very approachable wine list and upon asking will show you a much more extensive list. A neighboring table ordered the chocolate mousse and after seeing that, we had to have a taste and it was divine.

original_text: Perched on an upper floor above the Seine, with floor to ceiling windows, you sit in a rich atmosphere and gaze down the seine toward Notre Dame and the lights of Paris. All of that and glorious food accompanied by one of the largest wine lists in the world and everything is served by a friendly attentive staff. For your most special occasion in Paris, La T.our d'Argent is simply THE BEST.
text: Perched on an upper floor above the Seine, with floor to ceiling windows, you sit in a rich atmosphere and gaze down the seine toward Notre Dame and the lights of Paris. All of that and glorious food accompanied by one of the largest wine lists in the world and everything is served by a friendly attentive staff. For your most special occasion in Paris, La T.our d'Argent is simply THE BEST.

original_text: We went for the roast chicken because this restaurant claimed it was the best in Paris and unfortunately it was not good. Both of our chickens were overcooked and dry, and barely any jus. Unfortunately it was inedible. The front of the house manager was excellent. We paid for our meal but it was the worst we've ever had and unexpectedly poor :(

original_text: Food was average. Appetiser was the best, chicken was bland, dessert was average at best. Waiters were slow to get order (55minutes) and also avoided us as we were looking to get cheque. Would not go back.

original_text: Everything is great, we love this restaurant and must come back next time.

original_text: Amazing experience! The staff and service were truly amazing! If I have to add a constructive comment, would be to add more variety to the menu.

original_text: What a disappointment. We had a wonderful lunch here 4 years ago. Both food and service were exemplary. This time the roast chicken was overcooked and dry in the breast. The skin was not at all crisp. We wondered whether it had been sitting around being kept warm. For these prices and the restaurant's reputation we had a right to expect better. I will say that the mashed potatoes were properly buttery.

original_text: We were impressed with the quality of the food and service. Our waiter had a wonderful sense of humor and made us feel very welcome. We were seated by the window and had a good view of the Seine. Before leaving, we were offered and enjoyed an aged Sauterne "on the house" because we were such a cute couple. It was our last night in Paris so we left the city with a wonderful memory.

original_text: Place is overrated. We had the roast chicken and it was dry and hard to even cut. The duck confit was also dry and chewy. Best part of the dish were potatoes. Waiter explained that is how they make their chicken as free range 🤨 Guy behind us was also complaining about their steak.

original_text: La Tour D'Argent is always a perfect evening. Wonderful food and wonderful hospitality. The newly renovated restaurant is a delight. If there was one thing that was not exactly perfect, it was the difficulty of getting a reservation for one person. While I understand the economics of serving one person rather than two, sometimes one must dine alone. I am hoping that next year I can obtain a reservation as dining at La Tour d'Argent is the highlight of my year.

original_text: Amazing terrace, right on the bridge. Food was very basic & not really great, kind of catering food. Disappointing for a restaurant affiliated to La Tour d'Argent. Service was okay but chaotic, had to serve ourselves in wine & water. Also, the terrace shuts down at 10pm, which they don't tell you when you book.

original_text: We dined on 2023.05.01, and I apologize for my directness, but our dining experience was very, very poor. Even though we arrived at the start of the dinner service, many dishes were already sold out, which was a shame. Moreover, the service was extremely slow, and while guests who ordered at the same time as us were already finishing their appetizers, our table was still empty. In the end, our starter and main course were served at the same time, and the waiter offered us a pâté as compensation for the delay. However, the waiter did not explain anything and just left the pâté on the table, which confused us as we thought it was a mistake. Only after we asked did we learn that it was a compensation for the slow service. As for the food itself, it was not outstanding, but perhaps taste is subjective, so I won't comment on that. Overall, we were very disappointed with the service quality. We had expected a good dining experience given the restaurant's many years of experience, but perhaps our expectations were too high.

original_text: It was a lovely experience to be seated on the bridge. The food was delicious. Just unfortunate that we had a big breakfast. I had hoped to be able to go to the Tour d"Argent but at least we were able to go to the Rotisserie!

original_text: I was very excited for our lunch at Rotisserie Tour D’argent. I’ve heard great things about this Paris institution. We had a 1 PM reservation and the restaurant was only 1/4 full. We were seated and then waited at least 10 minutes for the waiter to take our order. We ordered six escargot, the fish of the day, the lamb, and a half bottle of wine. We do not speak fluent French, so I pointed to everything on the menu as I said it, and the waiter wrote things down. We never got our escargot. The entrees arrived and were very tasty, but my lamb was more than half fat. The sauce was excellent, and hubby enjoyed his fish. When we mentioned that we never got the escargot the waiter seemed confused and said it must have been because he was tired. When we asked where the rest of our bottle of wine was he seemed confused about that too. So they brought out more wine. Then our original waiter disappeared and we finally were able to get the check and leave. Thankfully we weren’t charged for the escargot we never got. For a place that has been around for so long and supposedly prides themselves on their high level of food and service, it was extremely disappointing. There are plenty of other places you can eat in Paris for less.

original_text: The food, location and atmosphere of La Rôtisserie d'Argent are just brilliant.

original_text: The very nice waiter recommended appetizers which were delicious. The problem was the coq au vin. It was so chewy I couldn't cut it with the knife and fork. I resorted to picking up the pieces and chewing on them directly. (I feared the knife would slip and pieces of chicken might fly across the room such was the force I was using.) My husband called me a barbarian. The sauce was very good and the base of butternut squash worked really well. No one checked on us while we were eating. No one came by to refill my wine glass. Another odd point is that the coq au vin was served in a black pot. The waiter who initially served us used a cloth to hold the lid. He did not leave a cloth. When I went to get more sauce, I found out the lid was not hot, which was good since no cloth was provided.

original_text: I had planned a special birthday lunch, making reservations weeks in advance. I knew we were in trouble when the first 3 wines we selected were not available. I ordered escargot for an appetizer and my partner ordered only an entre. Her entre came but not my escargot. The waiter took her entre away, promising to keep it warm, though we were skeptical about the beef cooking too much. Nearly 15 minutes later, my escargot came. The sauce was tasty but I could wrestle out only one snail. I have been eating escargot since before the waitstaff was born and knew how they should be prepared. My partner's entre arrived and as expected was overcooked and dry. We did not order dessert. AVOID THIS OVER-HYPED RESTAURANT!

original_text: A waste of 143 €. Made a reservation for 21h, specifying the terrace with a beautiful view of the Seine River. Was told upon arrival that the terrace closed at 22h. I live in the neighborhood, speak fluent French, and requested menus in French - were given ones printed in English. I ordered the pork belly; the waiter dropped a plate of steak tartare in front of me, then left without a word. When I eventually did get the pork belly, it was dry and flavorless. I have seen noodles that were crispier than the soggy frites on my plate. My partner's steak was chewy and the béarnaise sauce yellowed and stale. The food perhaps was prepared by the construction team across the street? Not once did an employee ask whether we liked our food. Never. This restaurant clearly no longer cares. Neither do we care to ever return. Oh, and by the way. Yes, I am an American-born. But I am also a French citizen who lives a 7 minute walk from this restaurant. This restaurant experience was insulting and embarrassing, and made me feel ashamed to be French.

original_text: We enjoyed dinner at La Rotisserie during our last night in Paris. A bistro associated with the adjacent Michelin-starred Tour D’Argent (currently closed for renovations), we enjoyed delicious dishes and great service at this special place. To start our meal, we had the Duck Foie Gras with Red Port, Cherry Chutney and Hibiscus. It was outstanding. Rich and flavorful. The cherry chutney was the perfect accompaniment to the wonderful foie gras. Our main courses were the Pork Belly with Shiitake Mushrooms and Ginger Carrot Mousseline, and the Duck Confit with Sardalaise Potatoes. The pork belly paired with the mushrooms and ginger carrots was so good! An odd combination, definitely, but the ginger carrot mousseline was just amazing. Boyfriend said the duck was the best he’s had in Paris, and he had a lot of duck dinners! Moist and tender, with a rich sauce. We paired our meal with a nice bottle of Beaujolais. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly, checking on us frequently. There are outdoor tables across a busy street overlooking the Seine, and waiters would run back and forth, dodging traffic, to cater to guests seated there. It was windy when we visited, so we decided to sit on their indoor patio and enjoy the views from there. This was a wonderful “au revoir” to Paris. We look forward to visiting Tour D’Argent on a future visit!

original_text: EU60 deposit on reservation so clients can’t leave The worst house wine I remember having Food OK but nothing special

original_text: This restaurant was the WORST food that I have ever had in Paris or anywhere in the world. The chicken was soggy and not crisp. It seemed as if it was reheated. We ordered the French fries instead of the potatoes that usually come with the chicken. The reason we did so is because when looking around, everyone had not eaten theirs. The fries weren’t crispy or hot either. They had a strange flavor. I assumed that they were cooked in goose fat, which most Americans are use to. We usually use duck fat. Speaking of duck. I was excited to order duck confit, but it was sold out. DO NOT ever go here. We were so surprised as it’s on so many top Paris lists. Repeat, DO NOT eat here!!!!

original_text: Much confusion in these reviews. This is NOT the Tour d’Argent, a famous and ancient Michelin-starred restaurant. It sort of pretends to be affiliated, but I can’t understand how the real Tour d’Argent would permit that. This is not a good restaurant or a terrible restaurant. It’s an OK restaurant with a lively atmosphere, friendly waiters and mediocre, but certainly edible, food, at rather exaggerated prices. It is across the street from the real Tour d’Argent, which as of March 2023 is still undergoing a thorough renovation.

original_text: Nothing memorable about this restaurant. Tour d'Argent (the institution, which is closed for remodeling) is a lovely, gracious space, with wonderful food and impeccable service. La Rôtisserie d'Argent is many steps down from its namesake, and the food isn't delicious enough for the price. The roast chicken was fine, though under seasoned. My husband enjoyed the lamb dish.

original_text: We went on a recommendation for the half chicken rotisserie meal and it was as good as the reviews! We also tried the cheese platter which was all local cheeses and great. The staff is wonderful and the restaurant has a great location to just wander after your meal.

original_text: A tourist trap for Americans. Service was meh, food was slop, wine was blah, appetizer of escargot was fair, then the main course consisted of fries that looked and tasted like you’d see at an Applebees in Oklahoma (and frankly, I’d put my money on the Applebees fries), and the meal was completed with a large fatty slab of undercooked meat with no presentation whatsoever - all for over $150 for two (ridiculous even for Paris). “Dining” at the Rôtisserie d’Argent was an all around disappointment. If this is “the best meal you’ve ever eaten” as some reviewers stated, they must have never eaten out before.

original_text: Terrible. Firstly the staff were incredibly unhelpful and rude when someone didn't understand something on the menu. Later in the evening 2 of the waiters continued their rudeness mocking my guests' accents, it was awful. And mistake after mistake on the ordering. Secondly the quenelles were revolting, they tasted off. When we wanted to send them back, the waiter said, I don't think you are used to good food!! Thirdly the duck, Colvert, needed razor sharp teeth to get through it. Badly over cooked and like rubber. The rudeness of the waiters continued throughout the evening. The service was very slow. We do not like a rushed experience but this was insane. Quite unbelievable were the waiters who forced themselves into the photos our guests wanted to take as a souvenir of Paris. We have been many, many times but we will not being going back.

original_text: We visited on Valentines' Day with the special menu which cost 75€ per person and included an appetiser, entree and dessert. The food was absolutely amazing. For our appetisers, we had some smoked salmon and foie gras. The foie gras had me speechless because of how good it was, and I don't think I'd ever tasted anything like that in my life. For our mains, we had the entrecôte and some prawns. The prawns were very fresh and of a good size, and was overall a very satisfying meal. Dessert was also very cute and light, and a perfect way to end off our Valentines' Dinner.

original_text: We had a delightful time there, with delicious food and wine (even though the waiters were a little inexperienced), and we especially benefited from a table out front facing the Seine rather than the closely packed 2-by-2 tables inside.

original_text: The restaurant finally has a kitchen worthy of its setting.

original_text: I grew up in Paris so this restaurant always held a special place in my imagination. We visited two weeks ago on a Sunday for lunch where I wanted to treat my parents, my partner and a close friend of ours to something special and we had such a wonderful time. The dishes, the service, the wine, the view... Everything contributed to making this visit truly unforgettable. Big thank you to the team who were looking after us, it was perfect!

original_text: Disappointing experience all around. The maître de was unwelcoming and seemed irritated by our request to move tables even though the restaurant was practically empty. Our waiter was inattentive, slow and had a major attitude. Our wine came after our meals and we had to remind him multiple times. The food was fine but nothing very special. Chicken was dry. We noted in the reservation this was to celebrate my mom's 80th birthday and they made no mention of it. Don't waste a meal here - there are too many other great places in Paris to try.

original_text: This restaurant has lost its way. Formerly one of my favorites (pre-Covid) it now ranks at the bottom. It was bad on all counts and generally I try to be fair.
